exits.text: to the west into another room
to the east onto a balcony

intro.text:
You step up on to the ottoman and jump to reach the first intact stair. You pull yourself up onto your torso and just barely manage to heave the rest of your body over the ledge.

The rest of the stairs are sturdy enough and you make your way up to the second floor.

Your eyes blink open as the world around you comes into focus. You are in a small sparsely decorated bedroom with an antique style reminiscent of a time you can't quite place. 

You don't know how you got here... The last thing you remember was sipping a cup of coffee in that old diner on the corner of Jackson Square. The flavor of its chicory spice still hangs on your tongue, yet it seems like it all happened a hundred years ago. 

There was a girl, she was in trouble... You search your memory for more detail, but the strain hurts your head. It is an odd sensation -- it's not that you can't remember, but rather your brain just can't be bothered to do it right now. 

You snap out of your reverie and notice the details of the room.
The candlelit bed chamber is small, but cozy.

exits.text: west back to the small bedroom
east into a new room at the end of the hall

intro.text: You step through the door into a long hallway.

sceneList.name: The Billiard Room

intro.text: You step into a welcoming Billiard room.

sceneList.script:
changeInSceneDescription("billiard exit", {text: "To the east is the exit to the Billiard Room.", audio:""})
changeExitDescription("The Living Room", "east", "east to the Billiard Room", "")
once()

intro.text: You enter the master bedroom.

exits.text: to the west leading back to the hall of history

intro.text: You step onto a wide balcony. Looking out, you see a sky full of clouds, tinted a dark, unnatural purple hue. Rising in the distance you see a dim lighthouse, but beyond that you can't see any water on the horizon. In fact, you can't see much of anything. On the ground below the balcony, there is a stone patio beisde a grassy lawn.

You step into the hidden passage and make your way down the stairs. As you descend, the light grows dimmer and dimmer -- a chill runs up the back of your spine. When you reach the bottom step, you can't see anything.

exits.text: and up the curtain to the balcony

intro.text:
You climb down the curtain, scaling the side of the building -- your jacket billowing dramatically in the wind. 

The end of the curtain hovers a few feet off a stone patio. You leap down and look around:

The mansion towers imposingly next you. Its domed turrets and elaborately ornamented cornices and balustrades remind you of the Victorian style mansions in the garden district back in New Orleans.

exits.text: west along the path to the East Lawn
and up to the Lantern Room of the lighthouse

intro.text: You follow the path through a patch of trees and arrive at the base of a lighthouse.
You walk up north behind the mansion.
You walk to the lawn west of the mansion.

exits.text: down to the base of the lighthouse
west out to the exterior catwalk of the tower

intro.text: You swing back the door and head inside the lighthouse. After scaling the tower's long spiral staircase, you arrive inside the lighthouse's lantern room.

exits.text: to the east back to the lantern room

intro.text: You step out onto the metal catwalk that loops around the top of the lighthouse. A crisp breeze kisses your skin and the sky is filled with clouds tinted a strange purple hue.

You fly though the air at breakneck speeds until the cable gradually becomes less steep and dips enough to slow your descent. As you approach the mansion, your velocity slows and you manage to land on the rooftop with surprising grace.

sceneList.name: The Kennel House

intro.text:
You step into the old kennel house. Tumbleweeds of dog hair and piles of miscellaneous detritus pepper every surface. An unshaven mutt of a man shouts drunkenly from the corner:

"Ah! A fresh face! Come in lad, come in! Warm yourself by the fire and join an old kennel master for a drink!" He takes a long pull from a jar of some potent liquid you can smell from across the room. 

"I've gotten so sick of looking at the same goddamn faces. You know the problem with eternity? It never ends!"

sceneList.name: The Hedge Maze

exits.text: north further into the hedge maze

intro.text: You cross the threshold into the hedge maze, the verdant walls ensconcing you in a moonlit world of muted forest greens.

exits.text: west back through the window to the dog yard

intro.text: You enter the study. Rich mahogany paneling gives the room a certain glow of class and comfort.

sceneList.name: The Secret Lab

intro.text:
You twist the knob and light flashes on from the gas-lit lantern it's attached to. Your eyes adjust to the light and you take in your surroundings. 

You are in a laboratory of sorts. The room is filled with glass instruments, and intricate machinery.

sceneList.name: Inside the Maze

exits.text: to the west, through the maze, and back to the mansion's north lawn

description.text: This gorgeous door is carved from the finest mahogany. Inlaid upon its rich brown exterior are ancient scenes of men and women on horseback, toting water jugs and other unfamiliar objects. The symbols and scenes are reminiscent of both Egyptian hieroglyphs and Grecian pottery. It is just begging to be opened.

response.text: "Oh, Archie is my fiancé. He's the one that gave me this beautiful ring here. But he's been missing for such a long time. Days, maybe even weeks. It's so hard to keep track of time in this place, but you'll find that out if you haven't already. I do miss him so. I hope he's all right, but if he is, he's got some serious explaining to do when he gets back!"

"My fiancé Archie gave it to me. Do you like it? Isn't it stunning? Sometimes when I'm waking up, the morning light hits it and it glitters like starlight. As long as I love my Archie, it will never leave my finger."

topics.name: this place
topics.script:
play("\"Oh dear, yes you must be a bit confused. When I first woke up in the mansion, I was so very afraid. Well, at least I think I was. That was so long ago, it's hard to remember. Memories tend to get little blurry in this place. Archie says it’s all a part of the Master’s work, but who knows what he does down there. All I know is this is his home, and I learned a long time ago to just enjoy what the Master’s given us. You will too. In time.\"\n\n\*\*New Topic Added: \"The Master?\"\*\*")
makeBroachable("maid","the master")
makeUnbroachable("maid", "this place")

topics.name: the master

response.text: The Master is...the Master. He's been here longer than any of us. He built this place -- Without him we wouldn't be here right now. Sure, it was hard when I first got here -- and he can be very cold. But that's just his way. When you meet him you'll understand. He'll be back any day now.

Sure, it was hard when I first got here -- and he can be very cold. But that's just his way. When you meet him you'll understand. He'll be back any day now.\"")
makeUnbroachable("maid","the master")

response.text: "He's locked in the closet, you say? You've got to get that key from the Kennel Master! He's probably drunk as a skunk in his shed outside."

topics.name: archie free

response.text: "My darling fiancé is back? That's wonderful news! I do hope rushes to me as soon as he is able!"
"Yes, you've said that, but where is he? If he's been delayed, then why has he not sent word?

actions.name: talk to
actions.script: changeInSceneDescription("Maid", {text: "In the corner of the room the maid scrubs the floor.", audio: ""})

greeting.text: "Oh my goodness! You startled me! I didn't hear you come in. I suppose I've been a bit preoccupied of late -- what with Archie being missing. But where are my manners! You're new here. My name is Cosette.
"Hello again. I hope you've heard some news of my Archie."

goodbye.text: "Goodbye, then. If you happen to hear anything about my Archie, please let me know. I do miss him so. "

inSceneDescription.text: In the corner of the room a woman in a maid's uniform scrubs the floor, oblivious to your presence.

description.text: Based on the uniform, it's safe to say this woman is a maid. Perhaps she can help you figure out what exactly is going on.
She's cleaning, but given the state of this place...not very well.

combinationFailure.text: You don't think she'd appreciate that.

inSceneDescription.text: An absurdly large diamond ring glitters on her left ring finger.

description.text: The diamond is blindingly beautiful. Literally. It's as if it's sucking in all ambient light and amplifying it straight into your eyeballs.

topics.name: Food
topics.script:
play("\"Our supplies have been dwindling since the Master left. We had a garden, but without the Master bringing us new seeds from the mainland, it died after the last harvest. There isn’t much here in terms of wildlife -- except for the boars, but the Master always did the hunting. But we manage, all the same. You see, food isn't really necessary when you're in a place like the Nexus... Though, I still do love a good meal. It’s the smells I miss the most. I don’t quite feel myself without all those scents to stir the mind and memory.\"")
makeUnbroachable("chef", "Food")

topics.name: Memory
topics.script:
play("\"You know, things all just seem to blur together a bit here. It’s been the same ever since I arrived, whenever that was, but at least when I was cooking I had my craft to keep me grounded. You know how smells can trigger a memory? Well, in a place like this, smells is pretty much all I have to stop from becoming adrift in the sea of monotony.\"")
makeUnbroachable("chef", "Memory")

topics.name: This place

response.text: "Well you must be new here if you haven’t met the Master. He’s a demanding fellow, with an impeccable taste for gourmet cooking. He found me some years ago and employed me as his private chef. Little did I know it would bring me here! Or that I would spend countless hours slaving away to cobble together culinary masterpieces from what meagre flora and fauna can be found this godforsaken place."

"Oh sure, I’ve thought about escape. We’ve all thought about it. But what good is thinking? Only the master knows. He always says if we want to leave it’s as easy as 1,2,3. His idea of a joke I guess."

topics.name: stove

response.text: "Damn thing’s out of gas. There’s some way to replace it, but hell if I can remember. The irony is, the only thing that could ever jog my memory here is the smell of food. But it’s not like I’ve got anything to cook with."

topics.name: thing he was supposed to remember

response.text: "Yes, dangnamit. What was it? Something the master said? Whatever it was, it was very, very important. Something I was supposed to help remember. Even the Master had issues remembering here sometimes – that’s why he was always writing in those diaries of his."

aliases: thing he was supposed to remember

list.text: That thing he was supposed to remember?

topics.name: passcode

response.text: "Yes...hmmm...the passcode. Funny thing. I can't remember it. Whenever Master wanted me to remember, he had me make the Eggs Benedict. The smell always jogged it back out of me. But then he'd take the recipe back, and I'd forget all over again."

topics.name: eggs benedict

greeting.text: "Well hello there. Have we met before? Excuse my memory, it isn't quite what it used to be, I'm afraid. In fact...there was something I was supposed to remember. Something important! Damn. Well, If you're hungry, you’re barking up the wrong tree. Not much here in the way of food anymore."

goodbye.text: "Oh, goodbye then! If I don't remember you next time I see you, well don't take it personal."

The mirror is warped and distorted, like the kind you might find in a funhouse.  You take a look at yourself. There you are. Tall, dark, handsome and more than a little wiggly-shaped. The collar of your tan trench coat cowls around your neck, giving you an almost aristocratic heir in the elevated aesthetic of this mansion.

topics.name: locked in
kennel master

response.text: "Yes. The wretch looks over the master's scent hounds. But I'm afraid the grounds are quite overhunted, and the idleness has driven the man into the bottom of a bottle. On a number of occasions he has behaved inappropriately around my dear fiancé, and a I daresay he is likely to go further, if he hasn't already! In fact, it wouldn't surprise me at all if my imprisonment is part of his muddleheaded scheme to snatch her away from me. You must help me, you must find the key and get me out of here!"

topics.name: key

response.text: "Yes, you know, the little metal thingy you put in door and twist. You have heard of doors haven't you? Or is that concept foreign to you as well?! Oh, I'm sorry if I'm being snippy, but I've been in here for ages and ages, you have to get me out! Find that mongrel Kennel Master, he's the key to finding...well. The key."

"I am Archibald E. Thunker, head butler of the Nexus manor. I have buttled this humble home for longer than most butlers can hope to achieve in their entire careers. It has been my greatest honor to serve here, and my greatest indignity to be introducing myself from inside this infernal cupboard."
"I am Archibald E. Thunker, head butler of the Nexus manor, and current occupant of this damnable cupboard."

topics.name: this place
topics.script:
if (!isBroachable("butler","his work")){
play("\"You are obviously new here, but undoubtedly you are already aware of the rather extraordinary nature of the Nexus. Having trouble remembering things? Does it seem like a certain something is missing from the world? What you are missing, my boy, is the tick of the minute hand. Don’t believe me? Look at a clock. This peculiarity is of the greatest interest to my master -- it is why our work here is so very important. But I’ve said too much.\"\n \n\*\*New topic added: \"His work?\"\*\*")
makeBroachable("butler","his work")
makeBroachable("freebutler", "his work")
makeUnbroachable("butler", "this place")
makeUnbroachable("freebutler", "this place")
}

response.text: "Well...I shouldn’t say anything, really. But If you truly wish to know more, then I suggest you find that key and get me out of here. Consider it your reward."

topics.name: the master

response.text: "The Ki’udba Alliga, it is the key to everything. But I won’t say more than that. Not until you get me out of here!"
"The only escape I’m concerned with is getting out of this cupboard! As for leaving the Nexus, the master would tell you it’s easy as 1,2,3. But of course he’s used to moving the hands of time!"

actions.name: talk to

greeting.text: "Hello? Who's that? Hello?! I'm trapped in here! That uncouth cretin locked me in while I was changing the bedsheets. Please you have to help me."

goodbye.text: "Please, please, find the key and get me out of here! I know things about this place...and if it's escape you want, I may be your only hope! Get me out and I'll tell you everything!"

response.text: "Oh this? Heh, heh...well you see there's this old stick-up-the-arse Butler fella. Always giving me a hard time that one. So I decided I'd teach him a bit'o'manners, I did. If that prissy little pansy wasn't in the closet before, he sure is now!"

topics.name: drink
topics.script:
play("\"Ho ho! One sip to put hair on your chest, and another to take it right back off!\" He hands you his jug. The stuff smells like rat poison. You pretend to take a sip, and hand it back to him. \n\n\"Huh! Took it like a champ. Most folks say it takes like rat poison. Well, good man!\"")
makeUnbroachable("kennel master","drink")

topics.name: the master
topics.script:
play("\"You haven't met him? You mean he didn't bring you here? Well, isn't that a trick! How did you manage that? He's a ripe old bastard, he is. One day we went hunting together, and the next he offers me a job. Hoped I might do it for the rest of my life, but little did I know there wasn't going to be a 'rest of' anything at all!\"")
makeUnbroachable("kennel master", "the master")

response.text: "Aren't they just lovely? English bloodhounds, through and through. Catch the scent of anything and they'd chase in down in minutes. Time was we did quite a bit 'o' hunting in these lands -- too much in fact. Now the only game around here is billiards! ...well, that and the occasional wild boar, I suppose."
"Ah, you want to get off this rock. Well I don't blame ya! Only one could ever go and leave as he pleased was the Master -- and he always said it was just as easy as 1-2-3."

greeting.text: "Go ahead, friend, I'm an open book. "

goodbye.text: "So long then! And don't be a stranger! Whenever you grow weary of the unceasing drudgery of existence, I'll be here with a drink in my hand."

topics.name: flowers delivered

response.text: "Please deliver my gift to my fiancé as soon as possible!"

topics.name: maid_1

response.text:
"My darling Cosette! She must be beside herself with worry. I must see her at once."

The Butler starts for the door, but stops when he sees himself in the mirror. 

"Dear god, look at the state of me. I can't let her see me like this. Oh, but I must let her know I'm all right. I shall write to her."

He pulls a pen and paper from his jacket and begins writing.

"I'll also need to give her something, by way of apology for my long absence. Something beautiful. Do you have anything like that?"
"Before I can send her this letter, I'll need some sort of gift to include. Something beautiful. Do you have anything like that?"

"The Ki'udbah Alliga. From what I understand, it is some sort of ancient runestone. It allows one to traverse the timestream, like a sort of mystical passport. The Master had one – it was what allowed him to bring us all here. As long as he had the stone, he was able to enter the doors of time."

topics.name: this place
topics.script:
play("\"You are obviously new here, but undoubtedly you are already aware of the rather extraordinary nature of the Nexus. Having trouble remembering things? Does it seem like a certain something is missing from the world? What you are missing, my boy, is the tick of the minute hand. Don’t believe me? Look at a clock. This peculiarity is of the greatest interest to my master -- it is why our work here is so very important.\"\n \n\*\*New topic added: \"His work?\"\*\*")
makeBroachable("freebutler", "his work")
makeUnbroachable("freebutler", "this place")

topics.name: his work
topics.script:
play("\"The Master is a scholar not of history, but of time itself. From what I understand this mansion exists in a nexus, a sort of inbetween point, or perhaps behind the curtain of time, as it were. This place is not only the object of his study, but a base of operations, from which he can travel to other periods as easily as you might board a train.\"")
makeUnbroachable("freebutler", "his work")

topics.name: the master

response.text: "The Ki'udbah Alliga. From what I understand, it is some sort of ancient runestone. It allows one to traverse the timestream, like a sort of mystical passport. The Master had one just like that, it was what allowed him to bring us all here. As long as he had the stone, he was able to enter the doors of time. But there's something wrong with that one. It looks like it's lost its spark."

topics.name: inert

response.text: "If I recall correctly, there is some way to re-energize the rune. It had to do with some notion of focusing starlight. It involved a clear night's sky, full of stars, and a sort of special telescope with a crystal at its base to concentrate the light."

topics.script: play("\"If I recall correctly, there is a certain way to re-energize the rune. It had to do with some notion of focusing starlight. It involved a clear night\'s sky, full of stars, and a sort of special telescope with a crystal at its base to concentrate the light.\"")

You unlock the door to reveal a man in his 50s. His tuxedo is dishelved and on his face is covered in few days' or weeks' growth.

"Oh my word. I can't thank you enough for getting me out of there...hey! Is that my jacket?"
"I can't thank you enough for freeing me. I'll be happy to answer your questions now."

Aw, that old sweetie.\"\n\n She takes the note and reads it:\n\n \"\'How I came by the misfortune of being stuck in this infernal place with a mongrel like you is beyond me. It\'s bad enough that you constantly smell of dog, but even your very face reminds one of that hateful canine race. And yet, it is hardly a surprise as you are the leader of all bitches. You are a truly disgusting excuse for a human being, and it would be my greatest pleasure to never encounter you, or your stench again. With deepest rancor, Archibald E. Thunker\'\"\n\n Her face turns a scarlet red and she tears up the note and throws the followers against the wall.\n\n\"That. BASTARD. No one speaks to me that way! NO ONE!
